FuncDef:
The import-route command configures RIPng to import routes from other routing protocols or RIPng processes.
The undo import-route command prevents RIPng from importing routes from other routing protocols or RIPng processes. The import-route command configures RIPng to import routes from other routing protocols or RIPng processes. The undo import-route command prevents RIPng from importing routes from other routing protocols or RIPng processes. By default, RIPng does not import routes from any other routing protocols or RIPng processes.
CLIs: import-route { { static | direct | bgp } | { { ripng | ospfv3 | isis } [ <process-id> ] } } [ [ cost <cost> | inherit-cost ] | [ route-policy <route-policy-name> ] ]
undo import-route { { direct | static | bgp } | { { ospfv3 | ripng | isis } [ <process-id> ] } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a ripng, ospf, or isis process.
A device can import RIPng routes from another process only when its ID is different from the local one.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 1.

Specifies the cost of imported routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15. The default value is 0.

Retains the original cost of the imported route.
-

Specifies the name of a route-policy used to filter imported routes. A device imports only routes matching the policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo: When RIPng and other routing protocols are deployed on a network, you can enable the traffic within a RIPng domain to reach a destination outside the RIPng domain using import-route command.
